metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.9 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 4 June to 17 September, 2012. The site (100.38546° E, 38.87239° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1543.34 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.9 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (Gill&Li7500A) was 0.2 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software (Li-Cor Company, http://www.licor.com/env/products/ eddy_covariance/software.html), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, angle of attack correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月4日至9月17日的通量观测矩阵中9号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.38546E, 38.87239N，海拔1543.34m。涡动相关仪架高3.9m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是20cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，角度订正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测，这些参数和观测无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，另一个因素是该区域强烈的对流环境。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
本信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下对冠层温度的高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的估计不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，在给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度的情况下，可以使用TSEB模型准确地将E和T从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data processing techniques like the Edire software used in flux observation datasets compare to the methods used for validating temperatures in the TSEB model using a high-resolution thermal camera?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 数据处理技术，如用于通量观测数据集的Edire软件，与使用高分辨率热像仪验证TSEB模型中的温度的方法相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Edire software processes raw 10Hz eddy covariance data into 30-minute intervals by applying steps such as outlier removal, time delay correction, angle correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction. These processed data are then quality-checked for atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity. Meanwhile, for the TSEB model, the soil and canopy component temperatures are derived from thermal images captured by a high-resolution thermal camera. This involves classifying images into soil and canopy pixels, extracting brightness temperatures, and converting these to radiation temperatures using emissivities and incoming long-wave radiation data. Both approaches emphasize data quality and specific corrections but differ in focus: Edire software processes temporal flux data, while the TSEB model involves spatial temperature data validation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: Edire软件将原始的10Hz涡度协方差数据处理为30分钟的间隔，应用的步骤包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、角度校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、声学虚温校正和密度校正。这些处理后的数据随后进行气候稳定性和湍流相似性的质量检查。同时，对于TSEB模型，土壤和冠层组件温度是通过高分辨率热像仪捕获的热图像得出的。这涉及将图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，提取亮度温度，并使用发射率和入射长波辐射数据将其转换为辐射温度。这两种方法都强调数据质量和特定的校正，但侧重点不同：Edire软件处理时间序列通量数据，而TSEB模型涉及空间温度数据的验证。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces using remote sensing data?

Additionally, the need for parameters and observations that cannot be easily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data limits the application of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用遥感数据准确估计异质土地表面的蒸散发面临的挑战主要是由于景观的复杂性，这些景观混合了具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被。此外，所需的参数和观测数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得，这限制了像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的应用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it particularly difficult to achieve energy balance closure in eddy covariance flux measurements in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流的灌溉农业区域，利用涡动协方差通量测量实现能量平衡闭合特别困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Energy balance closure in eddy covariance flux measurements is challenging in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas due to uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences. These differences are often dominant because of errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. The strong advective environment further complicates accurate flux estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，涡度协方差通量测量中的能量平衡闭合面临挑战，这主要是由于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。这些差异往往是主导因素，因为从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被成分温度时存在误差。强烈的平流环境进一步复杂化了通量估计的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the high uncertainty in estimating sensible heat flux in irrigated farmland using the TSEB model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型估计灌溉农田的显热通量时，高不确定性的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The high uncertainty in estimating sensible heat flux in irrigated farmland using the TSEB model is caused by classification errors in image pixel data, where soil pixels may be misclassified as vegetation pixels. This leads to overestimation of canopy temperature, particularly under conditions of developing vegetation abundance. Additional factors include ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用TSEB模型在灌溉农田中估计显热通量的高不确定性是由于图像像素数据中的分类错误，土壤像素可能被错误分类为植被像素。这导致在植被丰盛发展的条件下，冠层温度的过高估计。其他因素包括忽略大气向上的辐射以及在估计通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率时的不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using a high-resolution thermal camera for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层成分温度的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a high-resolution thermal camera allows for accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures, which aids in better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates. This technique helps separate latent fluxes with reasonable accuracy, despite challenges like image classification errors and uncertainties in radiation transmittance.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪可以准确测量土壤和冠层组件的温度，这有助于更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算。这种技术有助于合理准确地分离潜热通量，尽管面临图像分类错误和辐射透过率不确定等挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of employing a multiscale observation experiment to estimate evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 采用多尺度观测实验来估计异质土地表面的蒸散发的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to address the challenge of accurately estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous surfaces by using a multiscale observation strategy. This approach allows for the capture of complex eco-hydrological processes that occur across different scales, providing a more comprehensive understanding and improving the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是通过使用多尺度观测策略来解决在异质表面上准确估计蒸散发的挑战。这种方法能够捕捉在不同尺度上发生的复杂生态水文过程，从而提供更全面的理解并提高蒸散发估计的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to integrate both ground-based measurements and high-resolution thermal imagery in evaluating the two-source energy balance model?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在评估双源能量平衡模型时整合地面测量和高分辨率热成像是至关重要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with high-resolution thermal imagery is essential for accurately evaluating the two-source energy balance model because it allows for precise estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures. This integration helps in overcoming the limitations of composite temperature separation methods in arid regions and improves the validation of evapotranspiration and its components.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与高分辨率热成像相结合，对于准确评估双源能量平衡模型至关重要，因为它可以精确估计土壤和树冠组件的温度。这种整合有助于克服干旱地区复合温度分离方法的局限性，并改善蒸散发及其组成部分的验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are implemented to ensure the quality control of multiscale observational data in eco-hydrological research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，为确保多尺度观测数据的质量控制，实施了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In eco-hydrological research, quality control of multiscale observational data involves sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. The data are carefully quality controlled throughout these stages to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，多尺度观测数据的质量控制涉及传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。在这些阶段中，数据经过仔细的质量控制，以确保准确性和可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are eddy covariance systems utilized to measure turbulent fluxes in experimental areas with heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统如何用于测量具有异质地表的实验区域中的湍流通量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems are used to measure turbulent fluxes by being placed at specific heights, such as 4.5 meters above the ground, and sampling at frequencies like 10 Hz. These systems help in accurately capturing the fluxes in areas with heterogeneous land surfaces, such as those covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统用于测量湍流通量，通常安装在特定高度，例如离地面4.5米，并以10赫兹的频率进行采样。这些系统有助于在具有异质土地表面的区域（如玉米、蔬菜和果园覆盖的区域）准确捕捉通量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instrumental approaches are employed to capture thermal radiation data for estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业地区，捕捉热辐射数据以估算蒸散发所采用的仪器方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To capture thermal radiation data for estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural regions, a high-resolution thermal infrared camera is used. This camera is manually operated on a high platform to measure thermal radiation, and the data collected are then applied to estimate soil and canopy component temperatures, which are used in modeling evapotranspiration.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了捕捉农业地区蒸散发估算的热辐射数据，使用高分辨率的热红外相机。该相机在高平台上手动操作，以测量热辐射，收集的数据随后用于估算土壤和冠层组件的温度，这些温度用于蒸散发建模。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational instrumentation and techniques enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些观测仪器和技术能够在异质景观中收集多尺度生态水文数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data is enabled by a combination of hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, including flux observation matrices of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks for soil moisture and leaf area index, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文数据的收集得益于层次嵌套的仪器规模的结合，包括涡度协方差塔的通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络，以及使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do advanced remote sensing technologies enable the detailed monitoring of evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 先进的遥感技术通过哪些方式能够对异质土地表面的蒸散进行详细监测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Advanced remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers enable detailed monitoring of evapotranspiration by providing high-resolution data that captures the spatial variability and dynamics of land surface characteristics, which are essential for accurately estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪，能够通过提供高分辨率数据来详细监测蒸散发，这些数据捕捉了地表特征的空间变异性和动态变化，这对于在异质景观上准确估计蒸散发至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes using data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在使用数据收集方法估算异质景观中的地表通量时可能会面临挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a challenging task due to incomplete energy balance closure in EC flux measurements and uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences. Errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature also contribute to this challenge.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项具有挑战性的任务，这主要是由于涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中能量平衡闭合不完全以及表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。通过复合辐射温度确定表层土壤和植被成分温度的误差也加剧了这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected benefits of using multiscale datasets in the observation of oasis-desert interactions, and why might such datasets be challenging to compile?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度数据集观察绿洲-沙漠相互作用的预期好处是什么，以及编制此类数据集可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale datasets provide comprehensive insights into oasis-desert interactions by capturing eco-hydrological processes at various scales. Compiling such datasets involves challenges like ensuring quality control across diverse instruments and observations, such as eddy covariance towers, remote sensing technologies, and ground measurements.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集通过捕捉不同尺度的生态水文过程，为绿洲-沙漠相互作用提供了全面的洞察。编制这样的数据集面临着挑战，例如确保来自不同仪器和观测（如涡度协方差塔、遥感技术和地面测量）的质量控制。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing the multiscale eco-hydrological processes within heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉异质景观中的多尺度生态水文过程方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods, as demonstrated in HiWATER, are quite effective in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes through the use of hierarchically nested scales, which include flux observation matrices, airborne remote sensing, and eco-hydrological sensor networks. However, progress in this field is still hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, indicating room for further improvement in data capturing techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，如HiWATER所示，通过使用分层嵌套的尺度，包括通量观测矩阵、航空遥感和生态水文传感器网络，能够有效捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。然而，该领域的进展仍受到多尺度观测可用性差的限制，表明在数据捕获技术方面仍有进一步改进的空间。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges might researchers face in ensuring the accuracy of component temperature measurements in heterogeneous agricultural landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 研究人员在确保异质农业景观中组件温度测量的准确性时可能面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Researchers may face challenges such as image classification errors, which can vary with vegetation abundance, leading to inaccuracies in component temperature measurements. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could contribute to uncertainties, as well as errors in estimating short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy, affecting the overall Rn estimation accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 研究人员可能面临挑战，例如图像分类错误，这些错误可能因植被丰度的变化而导致组件温度测量的不准确。此外，忽视大气向上辐射和透射率可能会导致不确定性，以及在估计通过树冠的短波和长波辐射透射率时的错误，从而影响整体Rn估计的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: Can the methodologies employed in the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model be considered robust for separating soil and vegetation latent heat fluxes in strongly advective environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中，双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型所采用的方法论是否可以被认为是稳健的，以分离土壤和植被的潜热通量？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The methodologies employed in the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures are considered robust for separating soil and vegetation latent heat fluxes in strongly advective environments, as evidenced by reliable estimates of latent fluxes and accurate separation of E and T from ET. However, challenges such as uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences and image classification errors must still be addressed for improved accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: TSEB模型中采用的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的方法被认为在强烈的平流环境中有效地分离土壤和植被的潜热通量，这得益于对潜热通量的可靠估计以及对蒸散发（E）和蒸腾（T）从蒸散发总量（ET）的准确分离。然而，表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及图像分类错误等挑战仍需解决，以提高准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges in obtaining multiscale eco-hydrological observations in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在异质景观中获取多尺度生态水文观测的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenge in obtaining multiscale observations is due to the poor availability of such data. HiWATER addressed this by using hierarchically nested scales to capture eco-hydrological processes, involving a sparse network and a superstation, multiple EC towers, AMSs, and intensive remote sensing missions to gather comprehensive data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 获取多尺度观测数据的挑战在于此类数据的可用性较差。HiWATER通过使用分层嵌套的尺度来捕捉生态水文过程，涉及稀疏网络和超级站、多台EC塔、AMS和密集的遥感任务，以收集全面的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how datasets can be expanded to better understand evapotranspiration in heterogeneous land surfaces.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何扩展数据集以更好地理解异质土地表面的蒸散发。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets can be expanded by utilizing a multiscale observation system like HiWATER, which combines eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers, along with synchronized ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集可以通过利用多尺度观测系统如HiWATER进行扩展，该系统结合了涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及遥感技术，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪，同时同步进行植被动态和光合作用的地面测量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze how multi-scale observation experiments can be designed to effectively capture eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析如何设计多尺度观测实验，以有效捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Multi-scale observation experiments, such as HiWATER, are designed with instrumentation at hierarchically nested scales, including flux observation matrices, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This setup captures interactions between oases and surrounding deserts. Intensive observations are implemented at irrigation district scales, utilizing airborne remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers, combined with ground-based measurements to address the challenge of limited multiscale observations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测实验，如HiWATER，采用分层嵌套尺度的仪器配置，包括通量观测矩阵、涡动协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。该设置捕捉了绿洲与周围沙漠之间的相互作用。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测，利用激光雷达和成像光谱仪等航空遥感技术，结合地面测量，以应对有限多尺度观测的挑战。
